newsitem.title: USA: Wall St stocks expected to move higher at start.
newsitem.headline: Wall St stocks expected to move higher at start.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to move higher at the opening on Tuesday after losing almost 300 points over the last two trading sessions.
Analysts said that the National Association of Purchasing Management index, due at 1500 GMT and scrutinised for any clue to Federal Reserve action, would set the tone for the day.
While the market could see some stability on Tuesday, it was unlikely to rally before correcting more and going down to about the 6400-6500 level on the Dow.
U.S. Treasuries were unchanged to lower, with the long bond down 5/32 to yield 7.11 percent.
